item.title: Deadly Fire in Cairo Telecom Hub Causes Widespread Disruptions
item.description: A blaze at a key downtown Cairo telephone exchange left at least four people dead and another 27 injured, cutting off network services and forcing the local stock exchange to cancel Tuesday’s trading session.
item.dc:creator: Tarek El-Tablawy

media:content.media:description: Firefighters tackle a blaze at a a key telephone exchange in Cairo on July 8. Photographer: Amr Nabil/AP Photo

item.title: EU Chief Demands China Address Trade Imbalance as Tensions Flare
item.description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen accused China of distorting trade and limiting access for European firms two weeks ahead of a summit between the economic powers.
item.dc:creator: Michal Kubala, Max Ramsay

media:content.media:description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen Photographer: Jean-Christophe Verhaegen/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Trump Seeks an Elusive Peace Dividend in Gaza
item.description: Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu nominated Trump for a Nobel prize.
item.dc:creator: Dan Williams

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump, center left, and Benjamin Netanyahu, Israel's prime minister, center right, during a dinner in the Blue Room of the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, July 7, 2025. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told President Donald Trump he nominated him for the Nobel Peace Prize, using a visit to the White House to further cement the pair's relationship as the US presses for a ceasefire in Gaza. Photographer: Al Drago/Bloomberg

item.title: Germany Summons Chinese Ambassador Over Laser Targeting Plane
item.description: Germany summoned China’s ambassador over accusations that a military plane was endangered by a Chinese warship.
item.dc:creator: Michael Nienaber

media:content.media:description: A German Navy maritime surveillance aircraft.

item.title: Commercial Ship Under Continuous Houthi Attack in Red Sea
item.description: Yemen’s Houthi militants continued to pound a commercial ship in the Red Sea — hours after beginning an assault on the vessel that left crew missing — the latest sign that the Tehran-backed group is once again escalating its threat to the merchant fleet.
item.dc:creator: Mohammed Hatem, Sherif Tarek, Erik Olsson

media:content.media:description: The Magic Seas vessel.

item.title: US Mental Health Jobs Boom Faces Sudden Stop as Trump Cuts Funds
item.description: Mental health providers, the fastest-growing industry in the US since the start of the pandemic, risk a sharp reversal of fortune as President Donald Trump seeks to eliminate billions of dollars in funding that enabled their expansion.
item.dc:creator: Maria Clara Cobo, Nazmul Ahasan

item.title: Gambia Rejects New Constitution That Allows Barrow to Extend His Rule
item.description: Gambian lawmakers rejected a new draft constitution that imposed presidential term limits, but contained a loophole that would have allowed President Adama Barrow to run for re-election after his current five-year term ends in 2027.
item.dc:creator: Modou Joof

media:content.media:description: Adama Barrow

item.title: German Finance Chief Says Putin Threat Justifies Defense Buildup
item.description: Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil justified Germany’s massive ramp-up in military spending by arguing it’s essential to face down the threat from Vladimir Putin’s Russia and prevent German children ever having to experience war.
item.dc:creator: Kamil Kowalcze

media:content.media:description: Lars Klingbeil in the Bundestag in Berlin on July 8.

item.title: El misterioso asesor que maneja redes, discursos y poder en la Argentina de Javier Milei
item.description: Fanático de “The West Wing” y enemigo acérrimo de todo lo “woke”, Santiago Caputo revoluciona la política argentina.
item.dc:creator: Manuela Tobias

media:content.media:description: ONE TIME USAGE ONLY. Casa Rosada Santiago Caputo Argentina Foto Federico Lopez Claro

item.title: Milei’s Secret Weapon Is an Anti-Woke Devotee of ‘The West Wing’
item.description: Santiago Caputo is upending Argentine politics amid rumored tension with the libertarian president’s sister ahead of a crucial midterm vote.
item.dc:creator: Manuela Tobias

media:content.media:description: Tattoos peek through Santiago Caputo’s sleeves outside the Casa Rosada in Buenos Aires.

item.title: EU to Give Final Nod to Bulgaria’s Euro-Zone Entry Next Year
item.description: Bulgaria is set to clear the final hurdle to becoming the 21st member of the euro zone next year as European Union finance ministers meet Tuesday to sign off on its bid.
item.dc:creator: Slav Okov

item.title: Rubio Heads to Malaysia for Summit Under Shadow of Tariffs
item.description: Marco Rubio is making his first trip to Asia as the top US diplomat, heading to a summit in Malaysia a day after President Donald Trump again threatened to slam the region with high tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Eric Martin, Philip Heijmans

media:content.media:description: Signage for the 46th Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) Summit in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Photographer: He Guowei/VCG/Getty Images

item.title: Japan Gets 25% Tariffs With Room to Seek Deal Past Election
item.description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba called the announcement of slightly higher US tariffs “truly regrettable” while he vowed to continue to protect his nation’s interests in the extended trade negotiations.
item.dc:creator: Yoshiaki Nohara

item.title: Australian Premier Heads to China as Trump Stresses Alliance
item.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese plans to travel to China for the first time since 2023, seeking to strengthen ties with his country’s largest trading partner while its top security ally US aims to check Beijing’s presence in Asia.
item.dc:creator: James Mayger, Michael Heath

media:content.media:description: Anthony Albanese Photographer: Hilary Wardhaugh/Bloomberg

item.title: Russia Locks Up Population Data With War in Ukraine in Its Fourth Year
item.description: Unlocking a full picture of Russia’s demographic situation is becoming increasingly hard after the state stopped publishing monthly statistics amid the Kremlin’s war against Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Ben Sills

media:content.media:description: Commuters in Moscow.

item.title: South Korea Vows to Review Rules Following Trump’s Tariff Letter
item.description: South Korea said it will review regulations flagged by the US while pressing for an easing of sectoral tariffs after President Donald Trump sent a letter with a new August deadline for imposing 25% across-the-board levies.
item.dc:creator: Soo-Hyang Choi, Heesu Lee

media:content.media:description: Container ships are docked as shipping containers sit in the Busan Port Terminal (BPT) in this aerial photograph taken in Busan, South Korea, on Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2020. South Korea’s central bank left its key interest rate unchanged on Wednesday amid signs that a resurgence of the coronavirus at home is waning and exports and inflation are picking up.

item.title: Thailand Confident of Lowering US Tariff With Trade Offers
item.description: Thailand remains optimistic about securing a lower tariff rate than the 36% levy announced by President Donald Trump, based on its offer to reduce import tax on most US goods to zero, Finance Minister Pichai Chunhavajira said.
item.dc:creator: Suttinee Yuvejwattana, Pathom Sangwongwanich

item.title: Fresh From a Crisis, South Africa’s Ramaphosa Faces Another
item.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa is lurching from one crisis to another.
item.dc:creator: Antony Sguazzin

media:content.media:description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa during a plenary session at the BRICS Summit in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, on July 6.

item.title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa Sees Scope to Lower US Tariff in Talks
item.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said there’s the prospect that the US may lower a planned 30% tariff on goods in ongoing talks with Washington, as he challenged its calculation of the new levy.
item.dc:creator: S'thembile Cele

item.title: Trump Issues New Tariff Rates, Still Open to Negotiations
item.description: President Donald Trump unveiled a wave of letters again threatening key trading partners with high tariff rates even as he delayed the increased duties until Aug. 1 and suggested that he was still open to negotiations.
item.dc:creator: Josh Wingrove, Catherine Lucey, Stephanie Lai

item.title: Asian Economies in Rush to Cut Tariff Deals as US Deadline Moves
item.description: Asian countries including Japan and South Korea said they’ll keep pushing for a better deal for their exports to the US after President Donald Trump shifted his tariff deadline to Aug. 1 and tweaked the rates he’s set for many economies.
item.dc:creator: Yoshiaki Nohara, Soo-Hyang Choi

item.title: China Criticizes India for Modi’s Birthday Wishes to Dalai Lama
item.description: China complained to India after Prime Minister Narendra Modi sent birthday wishes to the Dalai Lama, a spat that risks complicating efforts by the two sides to mend ties.
item.dc:creator: Philip Glamann

media:content.media:description: Dalai Lama AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Netanyahu Says He Nominated Trump for Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told President Donald Trump he nominated him for the Nobel Peace Prize, using a visit to the White House to further cement the pair’s relationship as the US presses for a ceasefire in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Kate Sullivan, Stephanie Lai

item.title: Russian Drone Documents Draw Line From China to Ukraine’s Skies
item.description: Investigation shows how Chinese suppliers have been key for Russia’s war against Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Alberto Nardelli

media:content.media:description: A mass drone and missile attack by Russia on Kyiv on July 4.

item.title: European Group Decries China’s New Medical Device Restrictions
item.description: A European business group in China has criticized Beijing’s retaliatory measures targeting medical device makers from the European Union, saying the move worsens ties between the two economic powers.
item.dc:creator: Colum Murphy

media:content.media:description: Photo by Sebastian Kahnert/picture alliance via Getty Images)

item.title: Philippines Summons Chinese Envoy After Ex-Senator Sanctioned
item.description: The Philippine government has summoned China’s envoy to Manila, expressing concern over Beijing’s recent rare move to sanction a former senator who it accused of improper behavior on issues related to China.
item.dc:creator: Manolo Serapio Jr

item.title: Can Anyone in Britain Run a Government?
item.description: The UK is failing to produce a competent governing class.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Wooldridge

media:content.media:description: 11 June 2025, Great Britain, London: A "Diverted traffic" sign near the British Parliament. Photo: Julia Kilian/dpa (Photo by Julia Kilian/picture alliance via Getty Images)

item.title: Iran Supreme Leader Hints at Change to Unite Country
item.description: Senior clerics and military figures are looking to leverage Iran’s nationalist history to try and forge unity in the polarized country.
item.dc:creator: Golnar Motevalli

media:content.media:description: Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei attends an Ashura ceremony in Tehran, Iran, on July 5.

item.title: Bessent Aims to Meet With Chinese Official in Next Few Weeks
item.description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said that he expected to meet with his Chinese counterpart in the coming weeks to advance discussions on trade and other issues between the world’s two largest economies.
item.dc:creator: Akayla Gardner

media:content.media:description: Scott Bessent, US secretary of the treasury, speaks to members of the media after a Senate Republican policy luncheon at the US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Friday, June 27, 2025. President Donald Trump amped up pressure on Congress to speed the passage of his tax-cut bill as Republicans reached a tentative deal on the state and local tax deduction, one of the key sticking points in the negotiations.

item.title: Malaysia Commits to Trade Talks After Higher US Tariff Threat
item.description: Malaysia said it will continue to engage with the US after President Donald Trump threatened to impose a steeper tariff rate unless the Southeast Asian nation reaches an agreement with his administration.
item.dc:creator: Anisah Shukry
